page.title: 03THE CHRISTIAN COMMUNITY
page.content: A 1st. year class at Toot Hill School conducted a survey on the Christian Community in Bingham. There are four denominations: the Anglican, Methodist, Roman Catholic and the Olive Branch Christian Fellowship. Congregations can be as large as 150, and more adults than children attend church. The Anglicans form the largest community. The different demoninations cooperate a great deal. The Roman Catholics use the Anglican Parish church for their services. Every denomination helps to run the 'Third World Shop' which raises money for charity. The local community receives help too. Each Sunday there is an Anglican service at the Old Peoples' Home. Sunday Schools flourish and there are a variety of clubs for young people.
